title: War and Peace (1968) DVD 3
description:
Incredible the means made available to film Leon TolstoyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s great novel WAR AND PEACE, published in 1866. It took director Sergey Bondarchuk seven years to complete his sequel of four films. WAR AND PEACE was the most expensive production in cinema history. It was awarded the Academy Award for best foreign film in 1969. WAR AND PEACE is a stunning epic dealing with the Rostov and Bolkonsky families, heroism, fame and deterioration in Russia in the early years of the nineteenth century. It includes NapoleonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Russian campaign, causing the Russian nobility great problems. Napoleons invasion causes enormous chaos. The army has no other choice but the retreat and scorched earth tactics. Insufficient rations and a lack of provisions contribute to the devestation of NapoleonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s troops during the bitterly cold Russian winter. In spite of the war and its misery a love affair develops and finally Pierre (played by Bondarchuk) and Natasha can embrace each other.
